result.execSummary:
The defendant William Matlock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges or, civil judgment if not paid.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Complete a course in Anger Management.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
- Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Matlock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Matlock in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant is asking to have contact.  Agent to speak to the victim and can change the no contact order at his discretion.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant William Matlock in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Plea and sentencing proceeded....
 Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
.
Sentencing continued....
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months with the following conditions:

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36 on 11/20/2015 at 01:30 p.m..

Defendant William Matlock in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial.  Amended Complaint previously field, and copy provided to defense. Amended Complaint added the Domestic Abuse assessment (973.055(1)). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant plead not guilty. Parties have reached a resolution this matter. Court VACATED Jury Trial date and set matter for Plea & Sentencing in branch 36. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Received & Filed, Amended Criminal Complaint. 
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 973.055(1), a class B misdemeanor.

Discussion regarding No Contact Order. Court allowed for third party contact through Drina Lewis for arranging scheduling to allow victim and defendant to attend separate church services at 8267 W. Silver Spring Drive, Greater New Birth Church. Until scheduling is able to be arranged through Drina Lewis, defendant may still attend church service if victim is there, but may have NO direct contact with victim.

Defendant William Matlock in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel recently appointed.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Matlock in court Pro Se.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is NOT eligible for SPD or County appointment. Case adjourned to allow defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHARON M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William Matlock in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant William Matlock in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
